value.title: Fill down and replace null/blank values in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to troubleshoot fill down and replace blank values.  If you are trying to fill down blank values or replace null values you might see that power query ignores it completely. In this video I will show you how to fix this issues.    Looking for a download file? Go to our

value.title: Fix errors when importing or converting date columns in Power BI - Power BI Tips & Tricks #21

value.title: Import images in Power BI from local sources
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import images in Power BI with the help of SQL Jason.  He shows in his blog post how you can import images in Power BI from your local folder for offline use. value.title: List dates between two dates in Power Query
value.excerpt: Need to create a list of dates between a start date and end date? Well, let's look at how Imke did it in the Power BI community, it will blow your mind :) #curbal #powerquery #mlanguage #powerbi  Here is the thread on the Power BI community, where you can find Imke's code: https://community.powerbi.com/t5/Desktop/M-Power-Query-help-for-table-merge-Conditional-Cross-Join/m-p/478272#M222561

value.title: Normalizing data: The what, why and how
value.excerpt: Normalizing data in Power BI: The what, why and how  When analyzing data by population, plotting the row data against the geographical location will fail to reveal important patterns when comparing countries with big differences in population and this is when it is useful to normalize the data. Let me

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.
